question.title: How to register Handlebars partials in Java similar to JavaScript's registerPartial method?
question.body:
I'm trying to use Handlebars templates in my Java application, but I'm struggling to find the equivalent of JavaScript's Handlebars.registerPartial() method in the Java library.

In JavaScript, I can easily register a partial like this:

Handlebars.registerPartial('myPartial', '<div>{{content}}</div>');

But in my Java code, I can't find a similar method.I'm using the com.github.jknack:handlebars:4.3.1 library. I have multiple .handlebars files that I need to include as partials in my main templates. Is there any way to register Partial handlerbars ?

question_comments.body: According to Reusing {{ Mustache }} templates you can just use files as partials.
